title: Python Level 3 — Loops & Simple Number Algorithms
concept: Use while and for loops to iterate ranges, compute sums, factorials, and simple numeric properties.

challenges.title: Print 1 to N
challenges.description: Given an integer N, print all integers from 1 to N inclusive on one line separated by spaces.

challenges.title: Sum from 1 to N
challenges.description: Given N, compute the sum of all integers from 1 to N using a loop (do not use the formula).

challenges.title: Factorial
challenges.description: Given integer n (0 ≤ n ≤ 20), compute n! (n factorial) using a loop.

challenges.title: Count Digits
challenges.description: Given a non-negative integer N, count how many digits it has in decimal representation.

challenges.title: Sum of Digits
challenges.description: Given a non-negative integer N, compute the sum of its digits.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: sum of all decimal digits.

challenges.title: Reverse Digits
challenges.description: Given a non-negative integer N, print the integer that has the digits of N in reverse order (no leading zeros in output unless N = 0).

challenges.title: Power of Two
challenges.description: Given integer N, determine if N is a power of two (1, 2, 4, 8, ...). Print YES if it is, otherwise NO.

challenges.title: Number of Zeros in Sequence
challenges.description: First read integer N. Then read N integers. Count how many of them are equal to zero and print the count.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Smallest Divisor Greater Than 1
challenges.description: Given integer n ≥ 2, find its smallest divisor greater than 1 and print it.

challenges.title: Fibonacci Number
challenges.description: Given n (0 ≤ n ≤ 45), compute the n-th Fibonacci number assuming F0 = 0, F1 = 1.
